turns.raw_header: It looks like you used the tag !<q> before your message. While this isn't a standard command or syntax in most systems, it might be intended to indicate a "quote" or a special type of message.
turns.footer: If you meant to test quoting or a special function, your message was received! If you have a specific question or want to try another command, let me know how I can help.

turns.raw_header: I see you used !<o> before your message. This isn't a widely recognized command in most systems, but it could be your way of marking or categorizing messages (perhaps "o" for "output" or "option"?).
turns.footer: Your message "second test" came through clearly! If you're experimenting with custom tags or have a specific purpose for these, let me know how you'd like me to interpret or respond to them. I'm here to help!
